questions.text: A particular community population has been consuming Maize as a staple diet for years. The vitamin deficiency most likely to be seen in this population is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Niacin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Maize as a staple diet leads to niacin deficiency due to its low tryptophan and high leucine content, resulting in pellagra.
  • ➤ Note – Leucine is known as pellagrogenic aminoacid in India
  • ➤ Note – Leucine is known as pellagrogenic aminoacid in India

questions.text: Ebola virus comes under which Biosafety level category as given by WHO? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 4.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Ebola virus is classified under Biosafety Level 4 (BSL-4) by WHO, indicating it is one of the most dangerous pathogens requiring the highest level of containment.

questions.text: What alternative drug would you use for cardiac arrest if epinephrine is not effective? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Amiodarone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective :
  • ➤ Amiodarone is an effective alternative drug for cardiac arrest, particularly for ventricular fibrillation and pulseless ventricular tachycardia when initial defibrillation attempts have failed.

questions.text: A 45-year-old male presents with a 2-month history of persistent diarrhea, a worsening rash on his hands and neck, and episodes of memory lapses and confusion. His diet primarily consists of untreated maize (corn). Which vitamin deficiency is he most likely suffering from? (FMGE JAN 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Niacin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pellagra, caused by niacin deficiency, presents with a triad of symptoms: dermatitis, diarrhea, and dementia. A diet primarily consisting of untreated maize can increase the risk of this deficiency.

questions.text: A 2 years old child present to OPD at PHC with complaints of cough and coryza. On examination, fever and conjunctivitis are present. Mother told that the rash started behind ear pinna then came over the trunk. Most likely diagnosis is
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Measles

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Measles is characterized by symptoms like cough, coryza, fever, and conjunctivitis. The crucial diagnostic clue is the rash starting from behind the ear ( retroauricular origin ) and spreading to the trunk. This progression, coupled with the presence of Koplik spots on the buccal mucosa opposite the second molar before the rash appears, confirms measles.
  • • retroauricular origin
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Dengue: Typically presents with high fever and severe headache, pain behind the eyes, muscle and joint pains; rash is not primarily retroauricular.
  • • Option A. Dengue:
  • • Option B. Chikungunya: Presents with fever and severe joint pain but lacks the characteristic early symptoms and rash pattern of measles.
  • • Option B. Chikungunya:
  • • Option D. Rubella: While it can cause rash and fever, the rash usually starts on the face and spreads downward, and it lacks the specific Koplik spots associated with measles.
  • • Option D. Rubella:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Measles should be suspected in children presenting with cough, coryza, fever, conjunctivitis, and a characteristic rash starting from behind the ear, spreading to the trunk, alongside the presence of Koplik spots.
  • ➤ Koplik spots.

questions.text: A 35-year-old man presents to OPD at PHC with gum bleeding. This may be due to deficiency of (FMGE JULY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Vitamin C

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Vitamin C deficiency leads to a condition known as scurvy.
  • • Scurvy is characterized by impaired collagen synthesis, resulting in symptoms such as delayed wound healing, gum bleeding, and in severe cases, bone fractures. Collagen is essential for maintaining the integrity of connective tissues, and its deficiency directly affects the strength and healing capacity of tissues.
  • • delayed wound healing, gum bleeding, and in severe cases, bone fractures.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Vitamin A: Deficiency typically leads to night blindness and xerophthalmia, not gum bleeding.
  • • Option A. Vitamin A:
  • • Option B. Vitamin B12: Deficiency causes megaloblastic anemia and neurological symptoms but does not cause gum bleeding.
  • • Option B. Vitamin B12:
  • • Option D. Vitamin E: Deficiency is rare and mainly results in neurological problems and hemolytic anemia, not gum bleeding.
  • • Option D. Vitamin E:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vitamin C deficiency leads to scurvy, which is characterized by symptoms such as delayed wound healing, gum bleeding, and potential bone fractures.
  • ➤ Note - James Lind gave the concept that Citrus fruits can prevent/cure Scurvy (Later found to be due to deficiency of Vitamin-C/Ascorbic Acid).
  • ➤ Note - James Lind gave the concept that Citrus fruits can prevent/cure Scurvy (Later found to be due to deficiency of Vitamin-C/Ascorbic Acid).

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy is brought with weakness in his lower limbs and rash over the eyelids. The biopsy shows inflammation of the muscle. What is the finding shown in the image below? (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Gottron's papules

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In juvenile dermatomyositis , Gottron's papules are erythematous to violaceous raised lesions typically found over the extensor surfaces of joints and serve as a key clinical marker for the disease.
  • ➤ In juvenile dermatomyositis
  • ➤ Gottron's papules
  • ➤ violaceous raised lesions
  • ➤ extensor
  • ➤ joints
  • ➤ clinical marker

questions.text: Preferable time for IUCD insertion in a 28-year-old woman who has just delivered a healthy newborn. It was a normal vaginal delivery. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Up to 48 hours

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most preferable time for IUCD insertion after a normal vaginal delivery is within the first 48 hours postpartum to take advantage of the naturally dilated cervix and minimize expulsion risk

questions.text: The most common cancer found among the female population in India is: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Breast cancer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Breast cancer is the most common cancer among the female population in India, leading in incidence, prevalence, and mortality rates. Followed by cervico-uterine cancer, ovarian cancer, lip and oral cavity cancer, and colorectal cancer, respectively.

questions.text: A 32-year-old man from Rajasthan is diagnosed with mixed malaria infection – P. falciparum + P. vivax. Treatment regimen on Day 2 would be: (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Artesunate 50 mg (4 tablets) + Primaquine 2.5 mg (6 tablets)

options.label: B
options.text: Artesunate 50 mg (4 tablets) + Primaquine 7.5 mg (6 tablets)

options.label: C
options.text: Artesunate 50 mg (4 tablets) + Sulphadoxine/Pyrimethamine 750/37.5 mg (2 tablets) + Primaquine 2.5 mg (6 tablets)

options.label: D
options.text: Artesunate 50 mg (4 tablets) + Sulphadoxine/Pyrimethamine 750/37.5 mg (2 tablets) + Primaquine 7.5 mg (6 tablets)

questions.correct_answer: A. Artesunate 50 mg (4 tablets) + Primaquine 2.5 mg (6 tablets)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Artesunate 50 mg (4 tablets) + Primaquine 2.5 mg (6 tablets)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In mixed malaria infections involving P. falciparum and P. vivax, primaquine 2.5 mg is used on Day 2 along with artesunate to effectively treat both species.

questions.text: A woman who got IUCD inserted at a PHC, now presents with bleeding. What should be done by the MO? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Iron supplement and observation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Iron supplementation and observation are crucial in managing post-IUCD insertion bleeding to prevent anemia. If bleeding persists, further action, such as removing the IUCD, may be necessary.
  • ➤ Iron supplementation and observation

questions.text: Criteria for FRU include all except?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 24-hour MTP facility

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The criteria for a functional First Referral Unit (FRU) include:
  • • criteria for a functional First Referral Unit (FRU)
  • • 24-hour delivery services Emergency obstetric care, including surgical intervention (implying surgical intervention is a criterion) Blood storage facility RTI/STI management Newborn care Care of sick children Full range of family planning services, including safe abortion services (but not explicitly 24-hour MTP facility) Essential laboratory services Transport facility
  • • 24-hour delivery services
  • • Emergency obstetric care, including surgical intervention (implying surgical intervention is a criterion)
  • • Blood storage facility
  • • RTI/STI management
  • • Newborn care
  • • Care of sick children
  • • Full range of family planning services, including safe abortion services (but not explicitly 24-hour MTP facility)
  • • Essential laboratory services
  • • Transport facility
  • • The criteria "not included" for an FRU is the availability of a 24-hour MTP (Medical Termination of Pregnancy) facility. It states that while 24-hour delivery services are available, a 24-hour MTP facility is not explicitly listed as a criterion for an FRU.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a functional First Referral Unit (FRU), the criteria include 24-hour delivery services, emergency obstetric care (including surgical intervention), blood storage facility, RTI/STI management, newborn care, care of sick children, family planning services, essential laboratory services, and transport facility. However, the availability of a 24-hour MTP (Medical Termination of Pregnancy) facility is not explicitly a criterion for an FRU.

questions.text: A hair shaft with arthroconidia is seen in the image below. Identify the fungi associated with it? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Microsporum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Microsporum can be associated with fungal infections of the hair shaft, particularly in cases where arthroconidia are observed. Even though it is more commonly linked with ectothrix infections, it is the best option among the given choices for this scenario
  • ➤ Microsporum

questions.text: The best type of anesthesia for pre-eclampsia is? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Epidural anesthesia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epidural anesthesia is preferred for pre-eclampsia due to its ability to provide effective pain relief, avoid airway manipulation, and minimize drug passage to the fetus.

questions.text: Multiple Lisch nodules are a feature of which of the following conditions? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Neurofibromatosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lisch nodules are pigmented iris hamartomas specific to Neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1) and are an important diagnostic feature of this condition.

questions.text: What is true about this position? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The sniffing position aligns the oral, pharyngeal, and laryngeal axes, making it the ideal position for tracheal intubation

questions.text: A 57-year-old person completed his treatment of leprosy. Two years later, he presents with a punched-out painless ulcer on his sole. What is the next best step in the management? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Ask him to bear less weight on that leg and use plaster casts

questions.correct_answer: A. Ask him to bear less weight on that leg and use plaster casts
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ask him to bear less weight on that leg and use plaster casts

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the management of chronic trophic ulcers in leprosy, reducing pressure on the ulcerated area through weight redistribution, such as with a plaster cast, is essential to promote healing and prevent further complication

questions.text: As per the latest biomedical waste management guidelines in India, the following combination is incorrect? (FMGE JULY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Blue container – Incineration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blue containers for biomedical waste should not be incinerated but treated and then recycled as per the guidelines.

questions.text: Vitamin A deficiency is found to be associated with:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

questions.text: This position is given in which patients? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: C
options.text: Unconscious with Pulse present Breathing present

options.label: D
options.text: Conscious with Pulse present Breathing present

questions.correct_answer: C. Unconscious with Pulse present Breathing present
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Unconscious with Pulse present Breathing present

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The recovery position is used for unconscious patients who have a pulse and are breathing, to maintain airway patency and prevent aspiration.

questions.text: In which container will you dispose of the needle with the syringe after vaccination?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) White

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The needle of the syringe, being a metallic and sharp component, should be disposed of in the white container after vaccination. The needle, being a sharp waste, goes into the white container, which is specifically designated for disposing of sharp and metallic waste.
  • • After proper treatment methods like autoclaving, dry heat destruction, shredding, or mutilation, the contents of the white container are sent to iron foundries, sharp pits, or landfills for final disposal.
  • • Plastic component of syringe – in Red container

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 38-year-old man comes for a follow-up visit after a vasectomy. How long should he and his partner continue using a barrier method of contraception after the procedure? (FMGE JAN 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. 12-16 Weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Post-vasectomy, it is recommended to continue using a barrier contraceptive method for 12-16 weeks to ensure that all remaining sperm have been cleared from the ejaculatory ducts.

questions.text: Identify the contraceptive device shown in the photograph: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Lippes Loop

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Lippes Loop is an older, non-medicated, inert IUD that was once widely used but has been largely replaced by more effective copper and hormone-releasing IUDs in modern contraceptive practice.

questions.text: A person reported to OPD alongside his 32-year-old brother working in a factory. The brother was recently subjected to a test – Coproporphyrin in urine. The physician should suspect: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Coproporphyrin in urine is an important screening test for lead poisoning, indicating exposure to lead, and should be followed by diagnostic tests to assess absorption.

questions.text: Relieving pressure of pop off valve in this device is? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 30-40 cm H2O

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The pop-off valve in a manual resuscitator is typically set to relieve pressure at 30-40 cm H2O to ensure safe and effective ventilation without causing lung damage.

questions.text: A male patient with a history of unprotected sexual intercourse four days back came with complaints of painful urethral discharge. What is the treatment of choice? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Cefixime 400 mg stat

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The first-line treatment for gonococcal urethritis is a single dose of Cefixime 400 mg stat . This treatment is effective against Neisseria gonorrhoeae, the bacteria responsible for the infection.
  • ➤ Cefixime 400 mg stat

questions.text: The condition shown below can be treated by supplementation of which of the following? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Nicotinamide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pellagra, characterized by the "3 D's" (Dermatitis, Diarrhea, Dementia), is caused by a deficiency in Vitamin B3 (Niacin) and is treated with Nicotinamide supplementation.
  • ➤ Nicotinamide

questions.text: Serology of IPV vaccine strains is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Type 1, type 2, type 3

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The Inactivated Polio Vaccine (IPV) contains all three strains of the poliovirus: Type 1, Type 2, and Type 3. Although India switched from the trivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) to the bivalent OPV (containing only Type 1 and Type 3) as part of the global switch program in April 2016.
  • • The IPV introduced in the national immunization schedule still contains all three poliovirus strains. It is a trivalent vaccine, containing Type 1, Type 2, and Type 3 strains.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Inactivated Polio Vaccine (IPV) introduced in the national immunization schedule of India contains all three strains of the poliovirus: Type 1, Type 2, and Type 3, making it a trivalent vaccine.

questions.text: Dermatitis Herpetiformis as a skin manifestation is seen in cases of? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Celiac Sprue

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Dermatitis herpetiformis is a specific skin manifestation associated with Celiac disease and should prompt the evaluation for gluten sensitivity enteropathy in affected patients.
  • ➤ Dermatitis herpetiformis
  • ➤ Celiac disease

questions.text: A farmer with a history of prick injury came with the complaint: swelling of the foot with sinus tracts showing pus discharge, which showed white granules and gram-positive filamentous structures were noted on microscopy. What is the most likely causative organism associated? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Nocardia brasiliensis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mycetoma, or Madura foot, caused by Nocardia brasiliensis, presents with swelling, sinus tracts, white granules, and gram-positive filamentous structures on microscopy, distinguishing it from eumycetoma and other subcutaneous infections.

questions.text: While preparing a slide for histopathological examination (HPE), a box-like gross appearance is seen in the scanner view. In which of the following conditions is this seen? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Morphea

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Morphea, a localized form of scleroderma, is identified by a box-like or squared-off appearance on histopathological slides due to marked collagen sclerosis in the dermis.

questions.text: A civil engineer in Kerala is designing a wastewater treatment facility for a growing town. He considers implementing an oxidation pond, a natural wastewater treatment system. Which of the following best describes the microbial activity of the oxidation pond? (FMGE JAN 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Aerobic during day time and anaerobic during night time

options.label: B
options.text: Anaerobic during day time and aerobic during night time

options.label: C
options.text: Anaerobic during day time and night time

options.label: D
options.text: Aerobic during day time and night time

questions.correct_answer: A. Aerobic during day time and anaerobic during night time
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Aerobic during day time and anaerobic during night time.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oxidation ponds utilize aerobic microbial activity during the day and anaerobic activity at night to treat wastewater effectively.

questions.text: Identify the correct sequence of the family cycle.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Formation → extension → contraction → dissolution

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The family cycle consists of the following 6 stages in the correct sequence:
  • • Formation: From marriage until the birth of the first child. Extension : From the birth of the first child until the birth of the last child. Complete Extension - From the birth of the last child until the first child leaves home Contraction: from first child leaves home to the last child leaves home Complete contraction: from last child leave home to the death of first spouse Dissolution: From the death of the first spouse until the death of the surviving spouse.
  • • Formation: From marriage until the birth of the first child.
  • • Formation:
  • • Extension : From the birth of the first child until the birth of the last child.
  • • Extension
  • • Complete Extension - From the birth of the last child until the first child leaves home
  • • Contraction: from first child leaves home to the last child leaves home
  • • Contraction:
  • • Complete contraction: from last child leave home to the death of first spouse
  • • Dissolution: From the death of the first spouse until the death of the surviving spouse.
  • • Dissolution:
  • • The correct sequence is formation, extension, contraction, and finally, dissolution.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct sequence of the family cycle is formation, extension, complete extension, contraction, complete contraction and dissolution, representing the stages from marriage to the death of the surviving spouse.

questions.text: A patient with a painless expanding annular plaque with scarring at the center present on the buttocks. What is the diagnosis? (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Lupus vulgaris

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The correct answer is lupus vulgaris. Lupus vulgaris is the most common form of cutaneous tuberculosis. It typically presents as a painless, expanding annular plaque with scarring at the center. The lesion often advances at one edge while showing atrophy or scarring at the center or the other edge. This characteristic appearance helps in distinguishing it from other conditions.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Tinea: Tinea typically presents as an annular plaque with central clearing, not central scarring.
  • • Option B. Tinea:
  • • Option C. Psoriasis: Psoriasis usually presents with well-demarcated, erythematous plaques covered with silvery-white scales. It does not present with the annular configuration and central scarring described in the question.
  • • Option C. Psoriasis:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lupus vulgaris, the most common form of cutaneous tuberculosis, presents as a painless, expanding annular plaque with central scarring. This characteristic appearance is crucial for distinguishing it from other dermatological conditions such as tinea and psoriasis. ​​

questions.text: In the IMNCI guidelines for the management of diarrhea, the color code for some dehydration is:(FMGE JAN 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Yellow

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • In the Integrated Management of Neonatal and Childhood Illnesses (IMNCI) guidelines, diarrhea dehydration is classified into three categories:
  • • No dehydration – Green – Home management Some dehydration – Yellow – PHC based (MO) – 2 out of 4 criteria
  • • No dehydration – Green – Home management
  • • Some dehydration – Yellow – PHC based (MO) – 2 out of 4 criteria
  • • Four criteria:
  • • Four criteria:
  • • Restlessness Irritability Sunken eyes Skin pinch goes back slowly
  • • Restlessness
  • • Irritability
  • • Sunken eyes
  • • Skin pinch goes back slowly
  • • Severe dehydration – Pink - Is diagnosed based on the presence of two out of four criteria:
  • • Severe dehydration – Pink - Is diagnosed based on the presence of two out of four criteria:
  • • Lethargy Unconsciousness Sunken eyes Skin pinch goes back very slowly.
  • • Lethargy
  • • Unconsciousness
  • • Sunken eyes
  • • Skin pinch goes back very slowly.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the IMNCI guidelines for the management of diarrhea, the color code yellow represents "some dehydration," which is diagnosed based on the presence of two out of four criteria: restlessness, irritability, sunken eyes, and skin pinch goes back slowly.

questions.text: Mid-year population is the denominator in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) CDR

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The mid-year population is used as the denominator to calculate the Crude Death Rate (CDR). The CDR is calculated as the total number of deaths divided by the mid-year population, multiplied by 1,000.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. GFR (General Fertility Rate) - This option is incorrect because. It is calculated as Annual number of live births per 1000 women of childbearing age (15–49 years) mid-year population
  • • Option
  • • B. GFR (General Fertility Rate)
  • • Option C. MMR (Maternal Mortality Ratio) - This option is incorrect because the MMR is calculated as maternal deaths per 100,000 live births, not using the mid-year population as the denominator.
  • • Option
  • • C. MMR (Maternal Mortality Ratio)
  • • Option D. NMR (Neonatal Mortality Rate) - This option is incorrect because the NMR is calculated as neonatal deaths per 1,000 live births, not using the mid-year population as the denominator.
  • • Option
  • • D. NMR (Neonatal Mortality Rate)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The mid-year population is the denominator used in the calculation of the Crude Death Rate (CDR), which represents the total number of deaths per 1,000 population in a given year or period.

questions.text: Which vitamin deficiency causes conjunctival xerosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Vitamin A

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Vitamin A deficiency leads to a condition called xerophthalmia, which causes conjunctival xerosis, also known as dry eye. Xerophthalmia can be classified into two types: primary and secondary.
  • • Primary xerophthalmia has five categories:
  • • X1A: Conjunctival xerosis (dry eye) X1B: Bitot's spots (a specific manifestation) X2: C orneal xerosis X3A: Corneal ulceration X3B: Keratomalacia
  • • X1A: Conjunctival xerosis (dry eye)
  • • X1A:
  • • X1B: Bitot's spots (a specific manifestation)
  • • X1B:
  • • X2: C orneal xerosis
  • • X2: C
  • • X3A: Corneal ulceration
  • • X3A:
  • • X3B: Keratomalacia
  • • X3B:
  • • Secondary manifestations of xerophthalmia include:
  • • XN : Night blindness XF: Xerophthalmic fundus XS: Xerophthalmic scarring
  • • XN : Night blindness
  • • XN
  • • XF: Xerophthalmic fundus
  • • XF:
  • • XS: Xerophthalmic scarring
  • • XS:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Vitamin B12 deficiency is associated with megaloblastic anemia, peripheral neuropathy, and subacute combined degeneration of the spinal cord.
  • • Option A. Vitamin B12
  • • Option C. Vitamin B3 (niacin) deficiency leads to pellagra, characterized by the "4 D's" (diarrhea, dermatitis, dementia, and death). It does not directly cause conjunctival xerosis.
  • • Option C. Vitamin B3
  • • Option D. Vitamin B9 (folate) deficiency can cause megaloblastic anemia and neural tube defects in developing fetuses.
  • • Option D. Vitamin B9

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vitamin A deficiency causes xerophthalmia, which leads to conjunctival xerosis (dry eye) and other ocular manifestations, including Bitot's spots, corneal xerosis, corneal ulceration, and keratomalacia.

questions.text: A patient is undergoing implant surgery for his upper limb. On giving general anesthesia he develops tachycardia, sudden raise in body temperature and rigidity of muscles. What drug is most likely to have caused this? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Halothane

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Halothane, a volatile anesthetic, is a known trigger for malignant hyperthermia, characterized by hyperthermia, muscle rigidity, and tachycardia, especially in genetically predisposed individuals.

questions.text: A patient presented with nodular lesions over the body, which are associated with slight anesthesia over the arm in the ulnar nerve distribution. Histopathology is as shown below. Which of the following options is true about this condition? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Lepromatous leprosy with positive Lepromin test

options.label: B
options.text: Tuberculoid leprosy with positive Lepromin test

options.label: C
options.text: Lepromatous leprosy with negative Lepromin test

questions.correct_answer: C. Lepromatous leprosy with negative Lepromin test
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Lepromatous leprosy with negative Lepromin test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In lepromatous leprosy, due to poor cell-mediated immunity, the Lepromin test is typically negative. This form of leprosy presents with multiple nodular lesions and sensory loss, often in a symmetrical distribution.

questions.text: A young boy came to Derma OPD with complaints of severe itching at night. On examination, burrows are seen over intertriginous areas, axillae, umbilicus, and between digits. The disease is transmitted by? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Mite

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Scabies is caused by the mite Sarcoptes scabiei var. hominis , which burrows into the skin, causing intense itching, particularly at night, and burrows in characteristic areas such as the axillae, umbilicus, and between the digits.
  • ➤ Sarcoptes scabiei var. hominis

questions.text: Which of the following is not included in MMR?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Death due to RTA

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The Maternal Mortality Ratio (MMR) is calculated as the number of maternal deaths divided by the number of live births, multiplied by a factor of 100,000. Maternal death is defined as the death of a mother at any time during pregnancy, labour, delivery, or within 42 days after delivery, provided it is related to maternity or its complications.
  • • Deaths due to preeclampsia, ectopic pregnancy, and within 14 days post-partum are included in the calculation of MMR, as they are related to maternity or its complications.
  • • However, Deaths due to road traffic accidents (RTA) are not included in the MMR calculation, as they are not directly related to maternity or its complications.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Death due to preeclampsia - This option is correct because deaths due to preeclampsia, a pregnancy-related complication, are included in the MMR calculation.
  • • Option B. Death due to preeclampsia -
  • • Option C. Death due to ectopic pregnancy - This option is correct because deaths due to ectopic pregnancy, a pregnancy-related condition, are included in the MMR calculation.
  • • Option C. Death due to ectopic pregnancy
  • • Option D. Death on 14th day post-partum - This option is correct because deaths within 42 days after delivery are included in the MMR calculation, which includes the 14th day post-partum.
  • • Option D. Death on 14th day post-partum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Maternal Mortality Ratio (MMR) includes deaths related to maternity or its complications during pregnancy, labour, delivery, or within 42 days after delivery. Deaths due to causes unrelated to maternity, such as road traffic accidents, are not included in the MMR calculation.

questions.text: In which of the following devices is Murphy's eye seen? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Endotracheal tube

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective :
  • ➤ Murphy's eye is an important safety feature found in endotracheal tubes, providing an alternative pathway for ventilation and reducing the risk of mucosal trauma.

questions.text: All of the following are true about NF-1 EXCEPT: (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Autosomal recessive

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF-1) is an autosomal dominant disorder characterized by features such as café-au-lait macules, Lisch nodules, and optic gliomas. It is important to remember that it is not autosomal recessive.

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman with poor wound healing and hyperpigmentation around her wounds, along with swollen and bleeding gums, follows a restrictive diet avoiding many fruits and vegetables. Given her symptoms, which pairs of elements or compounds are critical for proper collagen synthesis? (FMGE JAN 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Ascorbic acid and copper

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For proper collagen synthesis, ascorbic acid (Vitamin C) and copper are critical elements.

questions.text: Edges of a Basal Cell Carcinoma are? (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Rolled out beaded

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The correct answer is rolled out beaded.
  • • Basal cell carcinoma (BCC) is the most common type of skin cancer, typically occurring in areas with high sun exposure. It often presents initially as a pearly white, translucent nodule with surface telangiectasias. As BCC is locally invasive, it can grow and lead to the formation of an ulcer. The characteristic edges of this ulcer are described as rolled out and beaded.
  • • Pearly white, translucent nodule with surface telangiectasias
  • • Ulcer with rolled out and beaded edges
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Sloping: Sloping edges are typically seen in healing ulcers.
  • • Option B. Sloping:
  • • Option C. Punched out: Punched out edges are characteristic of trophic ulcers.
  • • Option C. Punched out:
  • • Option D. Undermined: Undermined edges are seen in tubercular ulcers and chancroid.
  • • Option D. Undermined:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The edges of a basal cell carcinoma ulcer are characteristically described as rolled out and beaded, distinguishing it from other types of ulcers which have sloping, punched out, or undermined edges. ​

questions.text: A patient came with complaints of vesicular oral lesions, and on skin sample, DIF showed a fishnet pattern as given below. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Pemphigus vulgaris

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pemphigus vulgaris is associated with a characteristic "fishnet" pattern on direct immunofluorescence due to IgG deposition along keratinocyte cell membranes. Recognizing this pattern is crucial for diagnosis.

questions.text: What does phase III represent in the below image? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Alveolar plateau

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Phase III of the capnography waveform, also known as the alveolar plateau, represents the exhalation of alveolar gas and is used to determine the end-tidal CO2 level.

questions.text: What is the recommended dose of adrenaline for a child during cardiac arrest ? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 0.01 mg/kg (1ml/kg of 1:10,000 solution)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct dose of adrenaline for a child during cardiac arrest is 0.01 mg/kg using a 1:10,000 solution.

questions.text: The defined population norm for Urban-Primary health centre in our country is one such centre per: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 1 per 50,000

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The population norm for establishing an Urban Primary Health Centre (UPHC) in India is one center per 50,000 populations.

questions.text: What is the most effective circuit for anesthesia under spontaneous breathing in adults? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:

questions.text: Arrange the steps of the Demographic cycle in the correct chronological sequence: (NEET PG 2024) Low stationary High stationary Declining Early expanding Late expanding
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 2 4 5 1 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct sequence of the demographic cycle stages is: High Stationary, Early Expanding, Late Expanding, Low Stationary, and Declining.

questions.text: In a diabetic patient, the following lesions are present in the armpit. What would be observed during a Wood's lamp examination? (INICET NOVEMBER 2022)

questions.text: Arrange in order the disaster management cycle.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Impact → response → rehabilitation → mitigation

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The correct chronological order of the disaster management cycle is as follows:
  • • 5 stages -
  • • 5 stages -
  • • Impact: This is the initial stage when a disaster strikes an area, such as an earthquake, flood, or tsunami. Response : In this stage, search and rescue operations, first aid, and medical relief efforts are launched. Rehabilitation : This stage focuses on addressing water, sanitation, food supply, vector control, and other essential services. Mitigation : Efforts are made to prevent hazards or risks from turning into disasters, minimizing potential damage. Preparedness: This stage involves planning and preparation for an anticipated disaster, such as a tsunami or earthquake season.
  • • Impact: This is the initial stage when a disaster strikes an area, such as an earthquake, flood, or tsunami.
  • • Impact:
  • • Response : In this stage, search and rescue operations, first aid, and medical relief efforts are launched.
  • • Response
  • • Rehabilitation : This stage focuses on addressing water, sanitation, food supply, vector control, and other essential services.
  • • Rehabilitation
  • • Mitigation : Efforts are made to prevent hazards or risks from turning into disasters, minimizing potential damage.
  • • Mitigation
  • • Preparedness: This stage involves planning and preparation for an anticipated disaster, such as a tsunami or earthquake season.
  • • Preparedness:
  • • The answer to this is choice A, which correctly arranges the stages as impact, response, rehabilitation, and mitigation.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct order of the disaster management cycle is impact, response, rehabilitation, mitigation, and preparedness, representing the chronological sequence of actions taken during and after a disaster.

questions.text: A gymnasium owner found that people drank ice tea while exercising in his gym. He further mentioned that the subsequent weight loss was solely due to ice tea. This is a type of: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A spurious association occurs when a relationship is wrongly inferred between two variables due to a confounding factor. In this case, the gym owner incorrectly attributed weight loss to ice tea consumption rather than the true cause, which is exercise.

questions.text: Case fatality rate of the disease rabies is: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Case fatality rate (CFR) is used to measure the virulence of organism or killing power of a disease. CFR for COVID-19 and Chickenpox is about 1%. Measles has a CFR of 3%. Rabies has the highest CFR at nearly 100%, with no cure available once symptoms appear.
  • ➤ Case fatality rate (CFR) is used to measure the virulence of organism or killing power of a disease.
  • ➤ CFR for COVID-19 and Chickenpox is about 1%.
  • ➤ Measles has a CFR of 3%.
  • ➤ Rabies has the highest CFR at nearly 100%, with no cure available once symptoms appear.

questions.text: An adolescent male came with complaints of lesions all over the face and back, which were predominantly comedones. What is the most effective treatment for this condition? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Systemic doxycycline

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Systemic doxycycline is the most effective treatment for moderate to severe acne that involves comedones and inflammatory lesions, particularly when the condition is extensive.

questions.text: Identify the image: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bier’s block, or intravenous regional anesthesia (IVRA), is used for anesthetizing a limb by injecting local anesthetic into a vein while using a tourniquet to confine the anesthetic to the limb.

questions.text: Benzathine penicillin is given for the treatment of rheumatic fever. This is which level of prevention? (FMGE JULY 2024)

questions.text: Vaccine kept at the lowest level inside an Ice lined refrigerator (ILR) at PHC: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ OPV is stored at the lowest level of the ILR due to its requirement for the coldest storage conditions, ranging from 2°C and even tolerating freezing conditions, ensuring vaccine potency and effectiveness.

questions.text: What is the recommended treatment protocol for plasmodium vivax infection in pregnant females in the 1st trimester with complaints of headache and fever?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Chloroquine

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • For plasmodium vivax infection in pregnant females, especially in the first trimester, the recommended treatment is chloroquine.
  • • For vivax and ovale malaria, the treatment of choice is chloroquine along with primaquine. However, in pregnancy primaquine is contraindicated.
  • • For vivax and ovale malaria, the treatment of choice is chloroquine along with primaquine.
  • • However, in pregnancy primaquine is contraindicated.
  • • Since the specifically asks about the treatment protocol for a pregnant female in the first trimester with vivax malaria, the appropriate treatment would be chloroquine alone, without primaquine.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. ART combined therapy - This option is incorrect because artemisinin-based combination therapy (ART) is the treatment of choice for falciparum and malariae malaria, not vivax malaria in pregnancy.
  • • Option
  • • A. ART combined therapy
  • • Option B. Quinine - This option is incorrect because quinine is not the recommended treatment for vivax malaria in pregnancy.
  • • Option
  • • B. Quinine -
  • • Option D. Chloroquine + Primaquine - This option is incorrect because primaquine is contraindicated in pregnancy.
  • • Option
  • • D. Chloroquine + Primaquine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Treatment Protocol
